function.description: When a workbook contains formulas and the source cells are updated, then the workbook is not automatically updated with the new calculated value. `Excel.recalculate` scan the workbook for changed cell values and modifies the results of the formulas accordingly.
function.longDescription: The library used is an emulation of Excel. It is not using Excel itself. Doing a recalculation of a workbook can run into errors like missing functions, unexpected loop holes, etc. If this happens this function should not be used. Recalculating should then be done Excel.

example.title: Usage
example.header: `GEOMEAN` is an unknown function in the Excel plugin. Recalculating the workbook will run into an error: `Workbook contains unknown function 'GEOMEAN' in cell formulaSheet!C1`. In this case you have to open the workbook in Excel and do the recalculation there.
